alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:13AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Avoyelles and northeastern St. Landry Parishes through 145 AM CDT... At 113 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dupont, or 7 miles south of Moreauville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Krotz Springs, Melville, Moreauville, Palmetto, Bayou Current, Morrow, Cottonport, Evergreen, Plaucheville, Goudeau, Big Cane, Dupont and Lebeau. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
